moves.5... Qb6: [%clk 0:05:12] All main line till here, if I'm not wrong.
moves.7. axb3: [%clk 0:05:25] ...is bad for black, due to the semiopen column.
moves.7... Nf6 8. h3: [%clk 0:05:20] To shield the dsb if needed. This B will turn into a footstepper...
moves.9... Be7 10. Bc7: [%clk 0:05:13] ? I saw he couldn't play a7xB, so I could have played it there. Instead, I could have gone for it a move before. But it is a mistake, because, ok, I can put the B there, but it CAN'T take the pawn while Nc6 is there, so it's a bad plan. Ugly start.
moves.11. Bb6 Bd7: [%clk 0:04:48] ...and now my B is danger with no compensation. Black has developed very finely, thank to my ugly idea.
moves.12. Bc7: [%clk 0:04:52] With shame! Nothing better. Bc5, BxB, dxB leaves me naked in the center.
moves.12... Rfc8 13. Bf4: [%clk 0:04:50] If ever you could think a better way to waste four tempos, please show me!!! :-)
moves.13... h6 14. g4: [%clk 0:04:54] Of course I am more ambitious than simple developing-castling-and see what happens!
moves.15... Ne4: [%clk 0:04:20] Yes. Due to lack of developement, now I suffer. I didn't put the dsb on h2 because I'm eyeing a future h4, but now I realize that I just helped him, again!
moves.16. Ne5: [%clk 0:04:33] The plan was: he takes my B (NxB), I take his (NxBd7). He would likely take my R (NxRh1), and I'll have Nb6, forking the two rooks, while a7 is pinned again. The black N on h1 is whorth the f2 pawn.
moves.16... Nxe5: [%clk 0:04:03] Black, as predicted, sensed some trick, and went for this one, that momentarily saves my dsb.
moves.18. Bh2: [%clk 0:04:30] Now my B can go to a nearly seure refuge, at the cost of the loss of the h4 plan. I have to develop, but I have to be very careful with tricks like Nd2, Nxc3, bxc3, Rxc3. With the B pair, black will win easily like that, so developing the N via d2 is a dangerous option.
moves.18... f5: [%clk 0:04:06] As predicted, black will use his pawn's storm. And I have to find moves. f3 kicks black's N, but... then? I would never be able to take it back, and what future is there for my lsb? I looked hard, and I started to laugh.
moves.19. Be5: [%clk 0:04:20] Would I EVER play another piece during the game? But, look: it makes sense! It's the only drawback of f5. It blocks black lsb's action. Reactivates a latent threat on the h column, covering h8. The B is not easily kickable, and black would exchange his dsb for it. If black plays fxh4, while e6 stays there, it's all in my favour.
moves.19... Bd6: [%clk 0:03:52] Of course, black should have played f4, while f3 becomes impossible due to Ng3. Now, I can play BxB, NxB, f3 or h4. But, as always...
moves.20. Nd2: [%clk 0:04:12] Now after NxN, BxB! and I am who keeps the B pair.
moves.20... Bxe5 21. dxe5: [%clk 0:03:51] The latent threat Nxc3, saccing a N for two pawns is still possible, but I sense my opponent is not going for it.
moves.21... Nxd2: [%clk 0:03:46] As predicted. This helps me a lot.
moves.22. Kxd2: [%clk 0:03:54] The dust dawn, the game is still playable!
moves.23. Rh2: [%clk 0:03:43] The pawn in f3, I sense that is just cramping myself.
moves.23... Rcd8: [%clk 0:03:27] If d4, c5. This is going to a dead end, and a draw.
moves.24. Re1: [%clk 0:03:34] Setting gxf5 as a possible threat to have a goner. But on white square, it will be not optimal.
moves.24... Kg7: [%clk 0:03:18] This stops me from trying h4.
moves.25. Bd3: [%clk 0:03:22] Aiming to h7, just in case...
moves.25... f4: [%clk 0:03:16] Thanks black! You gave me hope. Because I have a7 in mind, not h8. See:
moves.27. f3: [%clk 0:02:53] Now I need this move in order to block Blsb's action on h1, in order to play my R there. Another plan was b4-b5, but with b6, Bb7, I would have got nothing.
moves.28. Ke2: [%clk 0:02:41] I have to cover f3. Note that e5 is untouchable!
moves.29... Rac8: [%clk 0:02:54] Another loss of tempo! I'm done!
moves.30... hxg5: [%clk 0:02:56] My opponent though in drawn, but I have seen this many moves before.
moves.31. Rh2h7+: This is the basis of my plan on h, and a move I felt some proud of.
moves.31... Rxh7 32. Rxh7+ Kg8: [%clk 0:02:50] Now I'm in control, and I can win a pawn. An important one.
moves.35. Rh5: [%clk 0:02:53] Again in control. It's a matter of time, now... for a win or a draw. Or so I thought!
moves.35... Kg7: [%clk 0:02:36] I can't believe it! Black didn't realize the nature of his bind, and allows me to repeat it once more. I couldn't resist! And I had my second laugh.
moves.36. Rh7+ Kf8 37. Ra7: [%clk 0:02:41] I thought this was smart, but it wasn't. Black can return me the courtesy with his R on h, and I don't want to lose for a stupid overconfident move. K to g2 are two tempos, too much. And d4 is still a latent break black has.
moves.37... Rh8: [%clk 0:02:34] I'm in no position to be foolish.
moves.39. Rxh8+ Kxh8: [%clk 0:02:32] And this, I think, seals the draw. Or it should. Can you believe? We went on. And we got the more interesting part of the game, due to mistakes. Let's see:
moves.40. Kf2: [%clk 0:02:11] I can penetrate into g5, so I force black to go there in order to defend it. I can't do much more than that!
moves.41. Kg2 Kh6 42. Kh3 Kg5: [%clk 0:02:32] I knew I'd have got late, but now if he goes, I'll go to h4. e5, believe it or not, is still untouchable!
moves.43. c4: [%clk 0:02:04] ?? I had to be sensible, and play for the draw. In fact, I think I offered it somewhere before now. I decided to see if e6 is worse or better than f3 (now I pay for have played it!)
moves.44. bxc4: [%clk 0:02:06] The idea is that if Bxf3, cxb5, and if Bxg4+, Kg2, axb4, Bxb5, and I am probably lost... his c pawn is nearer than my b one. A little headache for me!
moves.44... b4: [%clk 0:02:22] A surprise for me. I felt lucky again.
moves.45... a5: [%clk 0:02:22] I couldn't see that black is winning here...
moves.46. b3: [%clk 0:01:35] ?? A fatal mistake! Can you see it? Oh, my...
moves.46... a4: [%clk 0:02:20] My K is too far to help, and black will exchange and get promoted! After all, with this simple and innocent move I threw the game away!
moves.47. Bc2: [%clk 0:01:31] ?? Trying to get axb3, but of course...
moves.47... a3: [%clk 0:02:23] ! :-( I condemned my lsb into two squares! For nothing!
moves.48. Bb1: [%clk 0:01:33] You can laugh at me. I didn't laugh, here. What a stupid thing I've done! Now, black will get me in some kind of stupid zugzwang... sigh!
moves.49... Be8 50. c5: [%clk 0:01:17] Well... I have pawns too. This begins to look like a studio.
moves.56. Ba2 Kh4: He can hardly go further than that.
moves.57. Kf2 Kh3: [%clk 0:02:14] ?? "Finally", black got his K in. And, since my lsb is "pinned"... yes, but in doing all this, he forgets I have pawns too. And this is a definitive mistake. I didn't forgive him (chess is not for pity!).
moves.58. g5: [%clk 0:01:23] Black can't stop both pawns, g and c. Game over. Could you smile at least once? I hope so! If not, play the game in "fast forward", and enjoy the dsb's dance... :-D
